properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 21 at 3:59PM CST by NWS Chicago IL
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in
Illinois...

Fox River at Dayton affecting La Salle County

The following forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well
as forecast precipitation 24-48 hours into the future.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Fox River at Dayton, or from Millington downstream to confluence
with the Illinois River.
* until further notice.
* At  245 PM Tuesday the stage was 17.4 feet. River ice spotters
continued to report an ice jam beginning near Ottawa upstream to
near Dayton Dam. This ice jam has continued to cause fluctuations
in water level.
* Flood stage is 12.0 feet.
* Moderate flooding is occurring and Moderate flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will likely remain above flood stage for the
next few days while the ice jam remains in place. Additional
water level fluctuations are likely. Warmer weather late this week
should allow the ice to begin to clear.
properties.instruction:
Safety message...If you encounter a flooded roadway...turn around and
find an alternate route.
